alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 8:42PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...SNOW LIKELY ALONG AND WEST OF THE ALLEGHENY FRONT... Snow showers are likely for locations along and west of the Allegheny Front in western Maryland and West Virginia late tonight into Saturday morning. Accumulations around an inch are most likely, but heavier snow showers and perhaps even a snow squall are possible between 2 AM and 8 AM. Localized snowfall accumulations around 2 to 3 inches are possible. The best chance for heavier snow showers will be around Keysers Ridge, McHenry, Oakland, and Backbone Mountain just west of Bayard. Interstate 68, US 219, US 50, and US 40 will be impacted. The combination of accumulating snow with temperatures in the 20s means that roads can be slippery and snow covered through the morning hours Saturday.
